description.hltext_display: 调查称：中国本科毕业生仅一成符合外企要求
description.content:
今年企业人才需求旺盛，大学生就业形势好于往年，但著名经济学家温元凯认为，目前中国各大高校的本科毕业生中仅有一成达到外企所要求的工作能力，人才匮乏将阻碍中国内地公司的全球化。
近日温元凯教授在为武汉理工大学EMBA广州班授课时，引用中国某著名管理咨询公司的数据表示，中国目前大约有160万名年轻工程师，但其中有相当一部分正在进行培训。因为实践经验不足，中国大约只有16万年轻人适合在外资公司担任工程师，本科毕业生符合外企要求的只占到一成。他还认为，人才匮乏将阻碍中国内地公司的全球化。
据悉，内地许多公司在过去20年里正在不断寻找开拓海外新市场的机会，获取原材料、人才、技术、品牌和消费者。但许多公司管理层里对全球化有着准确认知的人太少，有不少企业表示，它们的全球化进程因为招不到优秀人才，总是止步不前。
有权威部门调查表明，中国在今后相当长的一段时间内，每年至少存在20万软件人才缺口。并且这个缺口还在以每年20%左右的速度增长，预计到2015年将扩大到42.5万人左右。其中，综合能力、应用能力较强的软件人才严重不足。 温元凯还以科技领域为例，认为中国研究和开发人员的数量世界领先，教育程度和发达国家接近，但总体竞争力却落后智利、比利时、马来西亚和泰国。对此，温元凯表示，下一阶段要把世界上最优质的人才吸引回国，并要大力发展生物科技、汽车、新能源等战略新型产业来提高整体竞争力。 (夏杨 文静)

description.hltext_display: China replaces top Foreign Ministry official
description.content:
BEIJING, China - China has replaced its top Foreign Ministry official amid a trend toward greater assertiveness in handling territorial disputes and participating in global organizations.
Vice Foreign Minister Zhang Zhijun took over recently as the ministry's Communist Party secretary, state media reports said Wednesday, meaning he outranks Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi. Yang was accused of being caught off guard when U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton announced at a security conference in Vietnam this year that Washington considered the peaceful resolution of South China Sea disputes as part of the American national interest.
Zhang, 57, had served almost his entire career in the party's International Liaison Department, a type of shadow Foreign Ministry focussing on contacts with foreign political parties, until he became deputy to Yang last year.
That party background may mean he has more of a say in policymaking than his predecessor, as China increasingly abandons its former low-key approach to dealing with the outside world. The country's rising economic clout amid the global economic downturn that has battered traditional powers such as the United States has emboldened Chinese leaders to demand a bigger say in global affairs such as climate change and at international organizations, including the United Nations.
China's aggressive assertion of its territorial claims in the South China and East China seas have, meanwhile, sparked a backlash from other countries in the region, drawing them closer to Washington.
The powerful People's Liberation Army is believed to be leading the calls for a tougher line in such disputes, while other cabinet officials have emphasized quietly advancing China's interests in economic, media and cultural spheres.
China's most senior diplomat, State Counselor Dai Bingguo, is seen as balancing the different arguments, although the country's opaque political system ensures that such debates almost never make it into the public arena.
Little is known about Zhang's personal style, although his party background and relative lack of experience working abroad suggest he will closely reflect the tone set by the party leadership.
Zhang's appointment was announced on official websites, including that of the party's People's Daily newspaper, but no exact date was given.
He takes over from Wang Guangya, a courtly career diplomat who was ambassador to the U.N. from 2003-2008, during which China took advantage of the U.S. preoccupation with Iraq to quietly expand its diplomatic space.

event_or_fact.property: Washington considered the peaceful resolution of South China Sea disputes as part of the American national interest.
in policymaking than his predecessor, as China increasingly abandons its former low-key approach to dealing with the outside world

description.hltext_display: 入札妨害容疑で追送検 国交省職員、ダム工事で
description.content:
Tweet 国土交通省九州地方整備局・嘉瀬川ダム工事事務所（佐賀市）が発注した工事をめぐる贈収賄事件で、福岡県警は２２日、特定の業者に落札させるために工事の入札情報を流したとして、官製談合防止法違反（入札妨害）の疑いで同事務所係長石橋秀志容疑者（３７）＝収賄容疑で逮捕＝を追送検した。
また競売入札妨害の疑いで電気工事材料販売会社「三共電気」（福岡市）の社長出口守容疑者（６１）＝贈賄容疑で逮捕＝を追送検し、工事を落札した福岡市の電気工事会社社長も書類送検した。 （共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: Afghan official rebukes NATO for civilian deaths
description.content:
KABUL - An Afghan provincial governor says NATO needs to exert greater caution in its operations following the death of five civilians during a battle with insurgents.
The office of the governor of Helmand province said in a statement Wednesday that the five civilians killed during the clash a day earlier included three women and two children. NATO says it is investigating the deaths, which Afghan officials say occurred during a Taliban raid on an Afghan national police checkpoint.
Afghan officials have repeatedly spoken out about civilian deaths, arguing that the international forces are not being careful enough to avoid such casualties as the war nears its tenth year. Insurgents also try to use the civilian death toll as a way of rallying support for their cause.

description.hltext_display: Nya tågproblem i dag
description.content:
SMHI har utfärdat en klass 1-varning för att omkring en decimeter snö kan komma fram i Hälsingland under morgonen och förmiddagen.
Trafikverket har satt in extra resurser för att gårdagens snöproblem ska undvikas även i dag. Trots det väntas kraftiga förseningar även i dag. På grund av växelfel kommer tågen på sträckorna Halmstad-Göteborg och Halmstad-Malmö, det vill säga Västkustbanan, att drabbas av kraftiga förseningar.
Även på sträckan Charlottenberg-Laxå är det problem med tågväxlar vilket orsakar störningar.
- Det vi har är efterdyningar av gårdagens stora problem med växelfel, säger Tommy Andersson på SJ:s pressjour.
- En del tåg har hamnat på fel plats i omloppet, kan man säga.
Ett 20-tal tåg i Mälardalen kommer att ersättas av buss och en del passagerare har blivit ombokade till andra avgångar.
Flygtrafiken till och från London ska återupptas i nära nog normal omfattning i dag.
- Som det ser ut just nu så har vi ställt in en Londontur från Stockholm i eftermiddag och från Göteborg ställer vi in en tur och retur till London. Resten hoppas vi verkligen att vi ska kunna få i väg, säger SAS informationschef Elisabeth Manzi.
Situationen i London är fortfarande kaosartad, SAS har närmare 6 000 svenskar strandade där.
För att få hem så många som möjligt planerar SAS att byta till större flygplan.
- Men det är svårt att sitta och lova något, det blir en så skör situation när så många är drabbade. Men nu håller vi tummarna, för vi behöver verkligen lätta på trycket.
- Självklart är vårt mål att alla ska få fira jul hemma. Vi gör allt för att få hem alla, säger Elisabeth Manzi.
SAS har kallat in extra personal för att svara på frågor och sköta ombokningar för alla de som drabbats, men väntetiderna har varit mycket långa.
- Vi hoppas på förståelse, men de har förstås behövt utrusta sig med en stor portion tålamod.
När det gäller Paris, Amsterdam och Frankfurt är man i stort sett i kapp med strandade passagerare eftersom trafiken har kunnat upprätthållas, om än med förseningar och inställda flyg.
Snöröjningen på Londonflygplatsen Heathrow har fått mycket hård kritik.
- Jag är inte någon expert på snöröjning men vi kan ju konstatera att de inte har klarat av att leverera det vi köper, nämligen möjligheten att kunna flyga till den flygplatsen. De har uppenbarligen inte klarat att leva upp till de önskvärda nivåerna, säger Elisabeth Manzi.

description.hltext_display: 日米、琉球主席公選で裏工作 沖縄返還前の６８年 (12月22日 11:44)
群馬組合、側溝製造販売で排除か 公取が警告へ
description.content:
Tweet 群馬県の技術基準に適合した側溝の製造、販売について、前橋市の事業協同組合「群馬県ＧＢＸ工業会」が、加盟社以外は参入できないよう制限していた疑いが強まり、公正取引委員会は独禁法違反（事業者団体の禁止行為）の恐れがあるとして、工業会に警告する方針を固めたことが２２日、分かった。
群馬県によると、この側溝は「群馬県型暗渠側溝（ＧＢＸ側溝）」で、県とコンクリート製品の事業者団体が共同開発。排水溝付近の勾配を緩やかにするなどバリアフリーの観点から共通の技術基準を採用している。 （共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: Groei Japanse economie zwakt volgend jaar af
description.content:
De groei van de Japanse economie zal in het komende gebroken boekjaar 2011/2012 afzwakken tot 1,5 procent. Voor het lopende boekjaar wordt nog gerekend op een economische groei van 3,1 procent. Dat liet de Japanse overheid woensdag weten.
Daarmee groeit de Japanse economie dit lopende boekjaar, dat eind maart afloopt, wel sterker dan eerder werd gedacht. De regering rekende oorspronkelijk voor het boekjaar 2010/2011 op een groei van 2,6 procent.
De afzwakkende economische groei in 2011 houdt vooral verband met de zwakke binnenlandse bestedingen in Japan en het wegebbende effect van de steunmaatregelen. Ook zet de sterke yen de export onder druk. De regering verwacht dat de werkloosheid in Japan volgend jaar zal dalen tot 4,7 procent van de huidige 5 procent.
De Japanse export
Woensdag werd verder bekendgemaakt dat de Japanse export in november voor het eerst in negen maanden weer sterker is toegenomen. De uitvoer klom met 9,1 procent vergeleken met een jaar eerder. In oktober steeg de export nog met 7,8 procent.
Vooral de Japanse export naar andere delen van Azië zat in de lift. De export naar Aziatische landen klom met 13 procent, geleid door China met een exportgroei van 18,3 procent.
De uitvoer
De uitvoer van Japanse producten naar de Europese Unie steeg vorige maand met 10,1 procent. De export richting de Verenigde Staten zwakte in november af tot 1,2 procent. In oktober steeg de Japanse export naar de VS nog met 4,7 procent.
De Japanse import klom in november met 14,2 procent. Het handelsoverschot van Japan bedroeg vorige maand 162,8 miljard yen (1,48 miljard euro).

description.hltext_display: Deaf worker catalyzes missions efforts in Prague
description.content:
PRAGUE (BP)—Never underestimate the difference one person can make.
Mark and Vesta Sauter came to the Czech Republic to start churches among the nation’s 50,000 Deaf. But the missionaries weren’t seeing a lot of interest until God brought them an unlikely volunteer—90-year-old Lillian Beard.
Lillian was a pioneer for Deaf work among Southern Baptists and a life-long mentor to Vesta. The women shared a common bond; as hearing children of Deaf parents, both learned sign as their first language.
Despite protests from friends, Lillian was determined to go to the Czech Republic to help the Sauters, even if it killed her. Vesta arranged for Lillian to speak at a Deaf community center in Prague, where her testimony touched a particularly hard-hearted Deaf Czech named Anna Smolkova.
Anna was the matriarch of a large Deaf family that was well-connected within Deaf Czech circles. Vesta knew that her conversion could catalyze the Sauters’ efforts to plant the country’s first Deaf church, but so far Anna had been very resistant—even hostile—to the Gospel.
“She said, ‘I want to make very clear to you that I don’t want anyone in my family to follow this Jesus,’” Vesta remembers. “She was just a bitter, angry woman.”
But Anna had never met someone like Lillian.
“The Deaf people [in the community center] were shocked [that a 90-year-old had come from the U.S. to speak to them],” Anna says. “I was amazed at how beautiful [her countenance] was, how she radiated. Something touched me inside about her, and I went and I knelt down before her and said, ‘What is it? Why are you so beautiful? Why do you radiate?’ And she signed to me, ‘It’s the love of Jesus.’ That struck a chord in my heart and a conviction, and I couldn’t run from it.”
Anna gave her life to Christ and quickly became the Sauters’ church-planting partner. God used her influence to lead dozens of Deaf to Christ, including many of her own family. What’s more, there are now six Deaf churches scattered across the Czech Republic as a direct result of Anna’s efforts—and Lillian’s obedience to God’s call.
The Sauters also credit much of the success to Southern Baptists’ commitment to pray when their ministry was a focus for the 2001 Week of Prayer.
“If every Deaf believer in the Czech Republic could stand before you today, their first words would be ‘Thank you, Southern Baptists,’ for making possible the spreading of the Gospel through their families and their communities,” Vesta says. “Today, we have Deaf-led churches because Southern Baptists gave, because they prayed, and because they even came as volunteers.”
Today, 10 years after Lillian’s visit, Anna continues to share Christ among Deaf Czechs and speaks fondly of her American friend who led her to Jesus. Lillian died in June of 2010 at the age of 101. She was an active advocate for the Deaf and for her Savior. God has since broadened the scope of the Sauters’ work—they now lead IMB’s global efforts to reach the Deaf.
You must be login before you can leave a comment. Click here to Register if you are a new user.

description.hltext_display: Innebandylag bestulet under match
description.content:
- De tömde omklädningsrummet. De flesta blev av med allt. Spelarna rusade ut på parkeringsplatsen i pausen för att se att deras bilar stod kvar, säger tränaren Magnus Jäderlund till Expressen.
Tredje perioden fick skjutas upp i tio minuter så spelarna kunde börja spärra mobiltelefoner och kontokort. Helsingborg vann med 6-3.

description.hltext_display: Samenwerking tussen KV Mechelen en Manchester City?
description.content:
KV Mechelen heeft een gesprek gehad met Manchester City over een sportieve samenwerking. "Drie weken geleden heeft een scout van Manchester City onze club bezocht", aldus sportief directeur Fi Vanhoof."Na het gesprek kondigde hij aan dat zijn club een voorstel zou doen, maar wij hebben intussen nog niks ontvangen. Het is allemaal nog heel voorbarig. In het verleden hebben we ook gesproken met Ajax en Chelsea en daar is niks uit voortgekomen. Maar als Manchester City een voorstel doet, dan zullen we dat zeker bekijken."
D
De mogelijke samenwerking met City, momenteel één van de rijkste clubs ter wereld, start zeker nog niet in de transferperiode van januari.

description.hltext_display: Asylum boat orphan relatives land in Australia
description.content:
SYDNEY (AFP) - Australian officials on Wednesday said they had found two aunts of a young refugee orphaned in last week's asylum boat sinking on later people-smuggling boats and arrangements were underway for a reunion.
The child, believed to be an Iranian boy aged about eight, was among three who lost both parents in last Wednesday's horrific boat smash off remote Christmas Island, killing an estimated 48 of the 90 refugees on board.
He was made a ward of Immigration Minister Chris Bowen after his status as an unaccompanied minor was established, but a department spokesman said two of his aunts had since been discovered on boats which arrived in the past week.
"Now that we've identified family that he does have, two aunts who were aboard a vessel that subsequently has come in to Christmas Island, we'll work with psychologists now to facilitate a reunion," the spokesman told ABC radio.
"That will be as advised by the psychologists when it is most appropriate."
All three orphans were being kept in a low-security facility on Christmas Island -- home to Australia's main immigration detention centre -- with family members and social workers while officials assessed their plight.
Prime Minister Julia Gillard has said minors and families from the shipwreck will live in the community under a new policy announced in October in a bid to ease severe overcrowding in Australia's detention centres.
Three boats have been intercepted off Australia since last week's disaster, carrying more than 150 asylum seekers.
More than 6,500 people, mostly Iraqis, Afghans and Sri Lankans, have tried to reach Australia this year on rickety boats from Indonesia, prompting debate about Canberra's relaxation of the former conservative government's harsh refugee policies.

event_or_fact.property: minors and families from the shipwreck will live in the community under a new policy announced in October in a bid to ease severe overcrowding in Australia's detention centres

description.hltext_display: 大阪、パト追跡の女子高生死亡 富田林の交差点で
description.content:
Tweet ２２日午前１時ごろ、大阪府富田林市甲田３丁目の交差点で、覆面パトカーが追跡していたミニバイクがタンクローリーと衝突した。ミニバイクの私立高校１年の女子生徒（１６）＝同府＝は搬送先の病院で死亡が確認された。
富田林署などによると、同日午前０時５０分ごろ、現場から約４キロ南の同府河内長野市内で、ヘルメットを着けずに走っているミニバイクを河内長野署の覆面パトカーが発見。交差点で信号無視したため停止を求めたが、そのまま逃走した。
タンクローリーの運転手は「信号が青になったので動き始めたら衝突された」と話している。女子生徒は無免許だった。 （共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: El Real Madrid quiere cerrar bien el año antes del parón
description.content:
Cinco partidos de la ida de los octavos de final de la Copa del Rey cierran este miércoles el curso futbolístico 2010, con diez equipos ansiosos por terminar con victoria y afrontar las vacaciones con tranquilidad, sobre todo el Real Madrid que no quiere que la marejada haga zozobrar al equipo antes de las fiestas navideñas.
MADRID, 22 (EUROPA PRESS)
Durante los cinco meses que llevan de temporada José Mourinho ha sido el protagonista indiscutible del equipo blanco y en el cierre el año no podía ser menos, aunque en este caso lo será por su silencio, ya que, tras su polémica rueda de prensa del pasado domingo, este martes cedió su asiento en la sala de prensa a Aitor Karanka, sin ofrecer explicaciones para este cambio.
De esta forma, la noticia es la ausencia de noticia, ya que el vasco, que se sentó en el banquillo cuando el luso estuvo lesionados, algo que no sucederá ante el Levante, se ha limitado a asegurar que no existe problema alguno y que en lo único que piensan es en estar en Cibeles.
Así, lo único destacable son las bajas para el partido en el que los blancos buscan dar su primer paso hacia cuartos. Mourinho sólo da descanso a Sergio Ramos, que forzó para estar ante el Sevilla, y cuenta con todos los disponibles, además de los canteranos Pacheco, Juanfran y Morata.
Por su parte, el Levante llegará al Santiago Bernabéu con la intención de dar la 'campanada', a sabiendas de que el objetivo es complicado debido al nivel del equipo rival. En el caso de no conseguirlo, la premisa que es han marcado los jugadores que entrena Luis García es anotar al menos un gol en el feudo madridista.
El preparador levantinista no podrá contar los lesionados de larga duración, ni con el portero Reina, que finalmente no se ha recuperado de sus molestias. El que finalmente sí que ha entrado en la lista de 21 convocados es el delantero Felipe Caicedo. El técnico podría dar minutos a los menos habituales, ya que considera que el equipo no baja el nivel por la igualdad que existe en la plantilla azulgrana.
SEVILLA Y MÁLAGA BUSCAN ALIVIAR SU SITUACIÓN
El Sevilla, vigente campeón, recibe al Málaga en uno de los peores momentos de los últimos años, sin conocer la victoria en los últimos siete compromisos entre Liga BBVA y Europa League, y con la necesidad imperiosa de salir de esa dinámica negativa, ante un conjunto de Manuel Pellegrini que tampoco encuentra la manera de corregir el mal juego de los suyos, y que ocupa actualmente uno de los puestos de descenso a la Liga Adelante.
El equipo de Gregorio Manzano no tiene otra que conseguir una victoria a costa de un rival teóricamente propicio y ante su público, que comienza a perder la fe en que se cumplan los objetivos marcados, pero que, a la vez, tiene en la campaña pasada el precedente de una temporada irregular que puede resultar exitosa gracias a la Copa del Rey.
Los malagueños, a la espera de la llegada de refuerzos en el mercado invernal, tratarán de poner las cosas difíciles en un Sánchez Pizjuán que se les da especialmente bien. No obstante, la preocupación por la situación liguera puede suponer una losa en la moral de los albiazules.
Por su parte, el Atlético de Madrid y el Espanyol se ven las caras en un duelo al que ambos llegan con trayectorias diferentes, ya que si los madrileños se reencontraron con el triunfo este fin de semana, los barceloneses vieron cortado su gran momento con una goleada en el derbi ante el FC Barcelona.
Los de Quique Sánchez Flores se aferran a la Copa del Rey después de caer eliminados en la primera fase de la Europa League, conscientes de que esta competición y la Liga BBVA son ahora sus únicos objetivos tras el traspié continental.
Y es que el Atlético, con la duda de Diego Forlán, inmerso en un estado febril, aspira a repetir presencia finalista como hiciera este año y para ello debe empezar tomándose la revancha de finales de noviembre cuando cayó por 2-3.
El Espanyol encara el viaje al Vicente Calderón con las ganas de olvidar la derrota del pasado sábado en el derbi contra el Barça (1-5) repitiendo su gran partido de aquél día, una de sus pocas actuaciones brillantes a domicilio en esta campaña.
Pochettino viajará pendiente de Manu Molina, que entrena con una protección nasal tras su fractura del tabique y con las bajas de Javi López, a pesar de estar recuperado de su lesión en el recto anterior izquierdo, y de Aldo Duscher, que el lunes viajó a Argentina para asistir al funeral de un familiar.
EL BETIS QUIERE SEGUIR SOÑANDO
Además, el Betis, líder destacado de la Liga Adelante, y cuya única derrota como local esta temporada fue, precisamente, en la Copa del Rey frente al Zaragoza (0-1), recibe al Getafe con la intención de conseguir, en esta ocasión, un buen resultado en la ida ante el equipo de Míchel que se encuentra en su mejor momento de la temporada, tras obtener cuatro victorias seguidas en Liga BBVA.
Los hombres de Pepe Mel, después dejar en la cuneta a un conjunto de la máxima categoría, buscarán repetir éxito con la ayuda de la gran pegada de la que están haciendo gala en la 'categoría de plata', donde son los máximos anotadores, con 11 dianas de ventaja sobre el segundo en este apartado. Sin embargo, la principal estrella verdiblanca, el camerunés Achille Emaná, se perderá el encuentro debido a los problemas que arrastra en su tobillo.
Para el Getafe, el choque se presenta importante de cara a seguir avanzando en un torneo donde ha ofrecido grandes prestaciones en los últimos años con las dos finales perdidas ante Sevilla (2007) y Valencia (2008), y las semifinales del año pasado, por lo que apostará por un buen once para acabar del mejor modo posible un gran año.
Los de Míchel llegan en una línea ascendente de juego y resultados, y a su buen momento victorioso esperan unir un buen resultado en el Benito Villamarín donde desean repetir su actuación en casa del gran rival de la ciudad de los béticos, con el triunfo por 1-3 en el Sánchez Pizjuán. En cinco visitas al Betis, cuando ambos coincidieron en Primera, el 'Geta' ha marcado siempre, salvo en una ocasión (2005-2006 --1-0--), logrando una victoria, dos empates y dos derrotas.
El Almería, que atraviesa un momento difícil tras volver a fallar como local, y caer ante el Getafe (2-3) en un partido en el que se dejaron remontar una diferencia de dos goles, recibe al Mallorca de Laudrup, que se encuentra en mejor situación pese a caer en casa del Villarreal (1-3) la jornada pasada.
Los hombres de Oltra tratarán de repetir victoria en el Estadio de los Juegos Mediterráneos, algo que esta temporada sólo han conseguido en Copa del Rey, frente a la Real Sociedad. Con ello, buscarán dar una alegría a su afición y obtener un resultado positivo que les ayude a olvidar las malas sensaciones ligueras.
El equipo bermellón quiere avanzar en una competición en la que, visto el rendimiento que está ofreciendo en Liga BBVA ante los equipos grandes, puede tener mucho que decir. Y es que Laudrup ha compuesto un equipo difícil de superar y que se crece en los partidos complicados.
--PROGRAMA DE LOS OCTAVOS DE FINAL (Ida).

description.hltext_display: PPL Corp. Sells Three Hydro Plants - Analyst Blog
description.content:
Electric utility PPL Corporation (PPL) successfully sold its remaining three hydroelectric generating facilities in Maine to the Penobscot River Restoration Trust, with a view to protecting the Atlantic salmon and other migratory fishes in Maine's Penobscot River. PPL Corp. will receive roughly $24 million for the sale.
PPL Corp. had reached a deal with a coalition of environmental groups and governmental agencies in 2004 to sell these facilities on the grounds of environmental protection.
Additionally, PPL Corp. will also receive $14 million in contingent consideration from Black Bear Hydro Partners LLC, an affiliate of ArcLight Capital Partners LLC, relating to the rights to increase output at certain hydroelectric facilities in Maine, which PPL had sold to Black Bear in late 2009. These conditional expansion rights and associated obligations were part of PPL Corp.'s original agreement with the coalition, and were transferred to Black Bear as part of the 2009 sale transaction.
The recent sale transaction along with the consideration from Black Bear is expected to result in a special after-tax gain of $0.03 - $0.04 per share in the fourth quarter of 2010. However, PPL Corp. reaffirmed its fiscal 2010 adjusted earnings forecast in the range of $2.80 − $2.95 per share compared to $1.95 earned in fiscal 2009.
The Zacks Consensus earnings estimates for the fourth quarter, fiscal 2010 and fiscal 2011 are 59 cents, $2.86 and $2.65, respectively.
Allentown, Pennsylvania-based PPL Corporation is a diversified utility company, primarily generating and marketing electricity in two key markets − the northeastern and western U.S. Through its subsidiary, PPL Electric Utilities, the company provides electric delivery services to about 1.4 million customers in Pennsylvania.
We maintain our long-term Neutral recommendation on the stock. PPL Corp. currently has a short term Zacks #3 Rank (Hold). The company ranks at par with its closest peers, FirstEnergy Corp. (FE) and Exelon Corp. (EXC).

description.hltext_display: 福島でパナマ船籍の貨物船座礁 乗組員らけがなし
description.content:
Tweet 第２管区海上保安本部（塩釜）に入った連絡によると、２２日午前９時４０分ごろ、福島県いわき市の海岸に、パナマ船籍の貨物船「ＳＥＡ ＡＣＥ」（２９６７トン）が座礁した。乗組員の中国人１１人とミャンマー人４人にけがはないという。
２管によると、船は宮城県から千葉県に向かう途中で、積み荷はなかった。油漏れなどもないという。乗組員から「乗り上げた」と連絡があった。当時、海上は秒速約２０メートルの強風が吹いて荒れており、風に流されたとみている。 （共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: 79-98. Milwaukee ridiculiza a los Lakers pese a un nuevo doble-doble de Gasol
description.content:
Los Ángeles (EEUU), 22 dic (EFE).- Los Milwaukee Bucks se olvidaron de sus importantes bajas por lesión y frustraron desde la defensa a Los Ángeles Lakers (79-98), que esta madrugada firmaron uno de sus peores encuentros de la temporada, pese a que Pau Gasol logró un nuevo doble-doble con 15 puntos y 11 rebotes.
Los locales, que regresaban a Los Ángeles tras una gira de siete partidos como visitantes, se desfondaron en la segunda mitad, donde anotaron únicamente 33 puntos, 13 de ellos en el último cuarto.
El base Earl Boykins, el jugador más bajo de la Liga, se convirtió en la estrella del duelo, con 22 puntos, mientras que el ex barcelonista Ersan Ilyasova contribuyó con 17 tantos y 11 rebotes. Por las filas de los Lakers destacaron Kobe Bryant, con 21 puntos, y Pau Gasol, con 15.
Se trataba de un partido trampa para los angelinos. Los Bucks se presentaban en el Staples Center con tres bajas sensibles (Brandon Jennings, Carlos Delfino y Corey Maggette), y para los locales resultaba inevitable tener en mente el próximo envite: el día de Navidad, frente a los Heat de LeBron James.
Sorprendió el entonado arranque de la pareja interior formada por Andrew Bogut e Ilyasova, que se combinaron para anotar 16 de los 25 puntos de su equipo en el primer cuarto, mientras Gasol y Lamar Odom tomaban las riendas de los suyos para recortar (22-25) una renta que llegó a ser de siete para los de Scott Skiles.
La entrada en cancha de los reservas igualó el duelo, con la aportación del diminuto Boykins y Larry Sanders por un lado y la explosividad de los "killer b's" (Steve Blake, Matt Barnes, Shannon Brown) por otro, aunque fueron los centímetros de Andrew Bynum, a pesar de su lentitud y de su visible cojera, los que mantuvieron a raya a los Bucks al descanso (46-50).
Los Lakers flojeaban en cuanto a ejecución en ataque e intensidad defensiva. Y en esa tesitura apareció Ron Artest para imprimir carácter a ambos lados de la cancha. Su actividad y ganas contagiaron a sus compañeros, a pesar de que el tándem Bogut-Ilyasova seguía causando estragos bajo el aro de los Lakers.
Los Bucks, con un Boykins ejemplar en la dirección y Salmons acertado en el tiro, sorprendieron con un último cuarto estelar en el que fueron aumentando su ventaja en los instantes finales hasta alcanzar una brecha superior a los 20 puntos (77-98).
Los constantes errores en el tiro de los locales y el magnífico esfuerzo defensivo de los de Skiles resultaron determinantes.
Los Lakers pagaron toda la apatía y los constantes toques de atención -sin respuesta- que fueron recibiendo a lo largo del duelo, e incluso llegaron a perder los papeles con la expulsión de Bryant por protestar a uno de los árbitros.
El día de Navidad acecha. Miami aguarda su turno. . Ficha técnica:
79 - Los Ángeles Lakers (22+24+22+13): Fisher (2), Bryant (21), Artest (4), Odom (12), Gasol (15) -cinco inicial-, Barnes (8), Blake (-), Walton (2), Brown (9), Bynum (6) y Ebanks (-).
98 - Milwaukee Bucks (25+25+20+26): Dooling (8), Salmons (20), Douglas-Roberts (6), Ilyasova (17), Bogut (15) -cinco inicial-, Mbah a Moute (8), Boykins (22), Brockman (-) y Sanders (2).
Árbitros: Spooner, Mott y Workman. Expulsaron a Bryant por protestar al árbitro.
Incidencias: Partido de temporada regular disputado en el Staples Center, de Los Ángeles, ante 18.997 espectadores.

description.hltext_display: Hickson receives incomplete
description.author: Jason Lloyd
description.content:
INDEPENDENCE: In an effort to learn his players' behaviors and understand what he was dealing with, Cavs coach Byron Scott tested J.J. Hickson two months ago.
Hickson didn't exactly pass the test. But it's too early to say he failed it.
Scott called out Hickson late in the preseason for his lack of focus and, at times, effort. He was hoping his young forward would lash back with a I'll-show-him type of mentality.
''He really didn't do that, which was what I wanted,'' Scott said.
Instead, Hickson felt lost. He stopped playing in the fourth quarter, which really affected his confidence even more than the public lashing. Then he lost his starting job.
He was unsure of his role on the team, unsure what Scott expected of him and unsure where to go to improve. Scott saw the loss of confidence, but he never feared his test to see how Hickson would respond had ruined him.
''I never felt early in the season I was going to lose him, it was a matter of seeing what I got and what I had and how can I approach him to get the very best from him,'' Scott said. ''I still think he has a lot of potential, it's a matter of him understanding that every night, you've got to bring that energy and effort.''
In Monday's loss to the Utah Jazz, Hickson decided to play hard. It was evident in the nine rebounds he grabbed and on the game film Scott watched Tuesday morning. He tried hard and he hustled on defense.
''That's all I asked from Day One,'' Scott said.
Now he has to do it again, beginning tonight in Atlanta.
Hickson worked so hard on a mid-range jumper over the summer, he seemed to lose what made him so effective last season, when he was constantly around the basket for easy putbacks and dunks off dribble penetration.
He hasn't been around the basket as much this season, instead drifting away to set up for his new jumper. He's averaging 10.3 points, but shooting 44.7 percent from the floor � significantly lower than the 55.4 percent he shot last season.
Shooting jump shots didn't cost Hickson his starting job, but his overall demeanor on the court and grabbing just five rebounds a game eventually did. Now he wants it back.
Asked how he's adjusting to his role as a reserve, Hickson responded: ''I don't think I've adjusted yet. I'm still trying to get my starting spot back. I know what I have to do, it's just a matter of me working hard every practice and every game and staying focused.
''Right now, I have to get back to the old J.J. with tip-ins, offensive rebounds and getting a lot of hustle points.''
That's a start, but it might not be that easy anymore. Scott likes the way the starters are playing as a whole, meaning any more changes to those five will come slowly. Hickson will eventually get another shot � he's too young and talented not to. But he'll have to toil as a bench player for the foreseeable future.
Scott initially hedged at the thought of playing Hickson at center, but now that he's a reserve, Scott isn't afraid to use him as a backup to Anderson Varejao. By playing Hickson at both forward and center, it shortens the minutes for other bigs like Ryan Hollins, who hasn't played in four of the past six games.
Scott has slashed his bench as much as possible in an effort to pull the team out of this losing funk. Barring injuries or foul trouble, he will use just three reserves as much as possible. Hickson is secure as one of those three, but his minutes have proven they will fluctuate depending on his effort level on any given night.
''I tell all the guys to make my job hard,'' Scott said. ''The one thing I want to do is be able to go in the office and try to figure out a way to keep guys on the floor. . . . Make my job tough for me to get you off the court. At times, it's been a little tough and at times it's been real easy. So make my job tough.''
Jason Lloyd can be reached at jlloyd@thebeaconjournal.com. Read the Cavs blog at http://www.cavs.ohio.com. Follow the Cavs on Twitter at http://www.twitter.com/ABJCavsInsider.

BM Genel Sekreteri uyardı: Savaş riski var
description.content:
BM barışgücü askerleri üzerindeki baskı artıyor
BM Genel Sekreteri Ban Ki-moon, tartışmalı devlet başkanlığı seçimleri sonrası Fildişi Sahili'nde iç savaşa dönülme riski bulunduğunu söyledi.Gbagbo'nun müttefikleri, çekilmedikleri takdirde barış gücü askerlerine isyancı muamelesi yapılacağını söylemişti.
Fildişi Kıyısı'nda devlet başkanlığı seçimini kazandığını iddia eden Laurent Gbagbo, devlet televizyonunda ilk konuşmasında zaferini savundu.
Gbagdo, seçim sonrası krizi değerlendirmek üzere özellikle BM ve Afrika Birliği'nin temsilcilerinden oluşan bir kurulun oluşturulmasını önerdi.
Laurent Gbagbo, seçimi kazandığını iddia eden Ouattara'nın, bulunduğu başkent Abijan'daki oteli terk etmesini de istedi.
Öte yandan, ordu seçimden bir gün önce getirilen sokağa çıkma yasağının kaldırılacağını açıkladı.
BM, seçimi Ouattara'nın kazandığını kabul ediyor, ancak mevcut Devlet Başkanı Laurent Gbagbo, yenilgiyi kabul edip görevinden ayrılmayı reddediyor.
Fildişi Sahili'nde 28 Kasımda yapılan seçim sonrasında yaşanan şiddet eylemlerinde şimdiye dek 50'den fazla kişi öldü, binlerce kadın ve çocuk ülkeden kaçtı.

description.hltext_display: With little practice, Wildcats still get win over Spartans
description.author: Jonas Fortune
description.content:
MOGADORE: Mogadore basketball coach Russ Swartz loved his team's effort and intensity Tuesday night.
He loved the result, too, after the Wildcats beat Springfield 63-52 at Mogadore High School.
But it's still obvious his team isn't exactly where it needs to be yet. At this point in the season, what team is? But the Wildcats are further behind then most.
Another great run by the football team into the Division VI state semifinals didn't give Swartz any of his players until after Thanksgiving.
''All of them. Every one of them. Every JV and varsity kid is a football player,'' Swartz said. ''We've been [practicing] for about three weeks.''
The first two games of the season were moved to later in the schedule, and they've had about 14 practices and one scrimmage, and a loss to Waterloo last Friday night.
The delay hasn't affected
some of their shots.
The Wildcats made nine 3-pointers, including four from Kodey Chance.
But this game was won on the defensive end of the floor.
Mogadore applied full-court pressure all game long, which caused plenty of turnovers.
And in turn, opportunities to make those 3-pointers they crave so much.
They spread the floor and found the shooters, making four 3-pointers in the first half.
It wasn't enough to put away Springfield, which had a true advantage in the post with senior Chase Cole, an athletic guard trapped down low because he was so much bigger than everyone else on the court at 6-foot-4.
Cole often wrecked the Mogadore defensive efforts with his rebounding and post scoring presence on his way to 19 points.
''We had no answer for him inside,'' Swartz said. ''Our goal was just to disrupt him so much getting up the court that they couldn't set up and get it inside to him. When they did, he hurt us.''
He got four three-point play opportunities and went to the foul line two other times.
But as good as Cole was, he was also a big reason Springfield (0-3) couldn't pull out a road win.
After the Spartans took a 28-25 lead in the third quarter, its first sustained lead of the game, Cole was whistled for a silly pushing foul and followed it with an even sillier technical foul for arguing with the official.
''That turned the momentum into their hands,'' Springfield coach Jack Morgan said.
All it did was spur an 8-0 run for the Wildcats that featured back-to-back 3-pointers by seniors Ryan Tarter and Adam Schrack.
Cole pulled the Spartans back within three points in the fourth quarter when he scored seven consecutive baskets, but a reach-in foul at the top of the key with about four minutes remaining ended his night, and any chance of a Springfield win.
''He is a good kid,'' Morgan said. ''He is learning and it will come, but that is Chase. He is going to play with emotion and sometimes it will get the best of him.''
Tarter finished with 21 points for Mogadore. Chance added 13 and Michael Duma finished with 11. Kyle Brooks had 14 points for Springfield.
Read the high school blog at http://www.ohiomm.com/blogs/varsity_letters/. Also on Twitter at http://twitter.com/ABJ_Varsity.

description.hltext_display: High school roundup: Noble ices down Massabesic/OOB
description.content:
SACO, Maine — Jesse Cotty scored two goals to lead the Noble High School hockey team to a 3-0 win over Massabesic/Old Orchard Beach on Tuesday at the MHG Ice Centre.
Cotty's goals were assisted by Nick Hudson and Dana Woodworth, while David Sullivan also scored with Grady Wheeler picking up the assist. Ben Haskell had 14 saves.
The Knights (3-0) play at Scarborough Thursday. Massabesic/OOB is 0-2.
GIRLS HOCKEY
STA/Dover 5, Concord 4 (OT)
DOVER — Dakotah Clement scored the game-winning goal at 4:54 of overtime to lead the St. Thomas/Dover girls hockey team over Concord, 5-4.
STA/Dover (3-0) also received goals from Kate Banys, Jadelyn Barbin, Shayna Murphy and Brenna Boulanger, who assisted on the winning goal. Molly MacKoul made 25 saves.
STA/Dover is off until after the holiday break.
BOYS BASKETBALL
Scarborough 52, Marshwood 42
SCARBOROUGH, Maine — A first half cold shooting spell spelled doom for the Marshwood boys basketball team, which lost at Scarborough in Western Maine Class A action Tuesday, 52-42.
The Hawks (3-1) scored just nine first-half points, trailing 20-9 at the break. They were down 33-21 after three quarters, cutting the lead to eight at one point in the fourth quarter.
Matthew Crosby led Marshwood with 12 points, followed by Jack Verrill and Tyler Hickey with 10 each, and Danny Veino with eight.
The Hawks play in the York Christmas Tournament, which starts Monday. They take on host York that night at 6:30 p.m.
Newmarket 53, Pittsfield 41
PITTSFIELD — The Newmarket boys basketball team cruised past Pittsfield in Division IV action Tuesday, 53-41.
The Mules (4-0) built a 48-24 lead after three stops and cleared the bench from there. Adrian Edgerly led Newmarket with 15 points and nine assists, while Christian Filion added 11 points with three 3-pointers. Ryan Carpenter had four points and eight boards.
The Mules play at Sanborn Thursday. Pittsfield is 3-1.
GIRLS BASKETBALL
Spaulding 51, Concord 31
CONCORD — Mary Nelson scored a game-high 29 points to lead the Spaulding girls basketball team to their first win of the season Tuesday at Concord, 51-31.
The Red Raiders (1-2) led 12-6 after the first quarter and took off from there. Haley Spiers added 12 points and Aly Towle chipped in with seven assists.
Spaulding returns to action in the Coe-Brown Holiday Tournament, taking on Lebanon Monday at 3:30 p.m.
Timberlane 40, Dover 37
PLAISTOW — The Dover girls basketball team dropped its first Division I game of the season at Timberlane Tuesday, 40-37.
It was back and forth in the last quarter until the Owls put together a little run to go up five. Jamie Boyatsis led the Green Wave (2-1) with 16 points, while Allie Mahan added eight.
Dover is back in action at the Nashua North Holiday Tournament, playing Bedford Monday, 6:30 p.m., at Rivier College.
Marshwood 55, Scarborough 47
SOUTH BERWICK, Maine — The Marshwood girls basketball team evened up its record at 2-2 with Tuesday's 55-47 win over winless Scarborough.
The Hawks were led by Jordan Mitchell with 15 points, while Mallory McPherson added 11 and Aubrey Folger threw in 10. Ali Bartlett played a strong game at point guard.
Marshwood plays at Sanford Thursday. Varsity tip off is at 1 p.m.
Portsmouth Christian 53, Moultonborough 43
MOULTONBOROUGH — The Portsmouth Christian girls basketball team beat Moultonborough on the road in Division IV action Thursday, 53-43.
Meagan Long led PCA (3-1) with 13 points, followed by Brianna Colizzi with nine and Karissa LeClair added eight.
The Eagles play in the Farmington Holiday Tournament on Sunday.

description.hltext_display: El aeropuerto de Heathrow aumenta los vuelos tras el caos por el frío
description.content:
El aeropuerto londinense de Heathrow, el mayor de Europa, aumentará el número de vuelos tras el caos de los últimos días por culpa de la nieve caída en el Reino Unido, donde los servicios ferroviarios también se han visto afectados.
Según informaron hoy fuentes de ese aeropuerto, Heathrow espera operar dos tercios de sus vuelos, después de que ayer reabriera su segunda pista una vez que los servicios de limpieza retiraran por completo la nieve que la cubría desde el pasado sábado.
Pese a todo, Heathrow ha pedido a los pasajeros que se pongan en contacto con sus respectivas aerolíneas antes de viajar hasta la terminal aérea para asegurarse de que sus vuelos operarán hoy. "Ahora trabajamos con las aerolíneas para volver al programa normal lo antes posible. Lamentamos mucho los trastornos que el tiempo causa a nuestros pasajeros", señaló un comunicado de Heathrow.

description.hltext_display: Couple shared God’s love for social outcasts before they met
description.content:
UDMURTIA (IMB)—Charlie and Heather Murphy* met Will and Marie Thompson* while attending seminary in Texas. The two couples discovered a mutual desire to share God’s love with the nations. Little did they know that God had a plan to send them to engage the same unreached people group in the Republic of Udmurtia, a small country west of Siberia.
Today, the Murphys and Thompsons are Russian language students in Izhevsk, the capital city of Udmurtia. They believe God has called them to show His love to the Udmurts.
“I loved the Udmurt people before I ever took a trip here, before I ever met one of them,” Charlie says. “And that really was just a love that came from God.”
The population of Udmurtia is largely Russian, while ethnic Udmurts make up only 30 percent of its inhabitants. Shy and quiet, Udmurts show themselves to be a warm, vibrant people once trust is built with them. They often are recognized by their distinct physical features, such as small stature, high cheekbones and a high percentage of redheads.
Udmurts often mix Russian Orthodoxy and pagan worship practices. Fewer than 0.3 percent are considered evangelical Christians.
Years of social and spiritual oppression have rendered the Udmurts as outcasts. Because of low employment rates, most Udmurts live in rural villages where they struggle to eek out a meager existence from their family gardens. It is no surprise that a general sense of hopelessness—expressed in depression, alcoholism and high suicide rates—plagues their culture.
“Without a doubt,” Charlie says, “the thing that burdens me the most about this people is just the depression. You can see it on their faces. They’re buying time until they can see what’s next.
Unfortunately, a lot of the animistic roots still remain in this region. Some turn to the animism, some turn to the Orthodox Church, but right now very few are turning to Christ.”
Will echoes these sentiments.
Udmurtia, he says, is “a place ready to receive the Gospel because there’s really not as much pride that you have to fight through. Hopelessness is just an open field—open soil for the Gospel.”
The couples pray daily for Udmurts to put their trust in Christ and boldly share their faith in their villages. These prayers are fueled by an earnest love for the people of Udmurtia.
“Why on earth would I love a people that I’d never met?” asks Marie. “Why would I want to go live with a people that I hadn’t really seen? I think only God can give you a love like that for a people group.”
Heather agrees. “I’m excited because God is doing something [among] the Udmurt people,” she says. “He loves the Udmurt people, and He has a plan for them, so I just want to be a part of that anyway that I can.”
* Names changed
You must be login before you can leave a comment. Click here to Register if you are a new user.

description.hltext_display: Inview Technology’s Collaboration with Haier Brings Innovative Connected TV Platform
description.content:
Inview Technology the world leading supplier of royalty free EPGs, has announced a partnership with Haier IC to facilitate the launch of its fully IP-connected platform Neelix across millions of TV?s and set-top boxes.
Haier, a leading force in digital home entertainment markets, is a global pioneer in innovative semiconductor solutions. A well-established, respected supplier of innovative silicon solutions, Haier understands the rapidly evolving marketplace and value of being first to market with exciting solutions.
Neelix incorporates an integrated EPG, media browser and personal schedule tool. It boasts a range of TV applications providing easy access to internet content including video streaming, instant messaging, news, weather reports and online radio without the use of a search engine or browser ? all with no added cost at manufacture.
Zhang Haitao, Product Director of Haier commented, ?Haier is focused on collaborating with market leading innovators, such as Inview, that provide robust connected Tv experiences to our consumers. Because Inviews platform constantly expands and adapts to the consumers needs, we have every confidence that the service will be a major part of our core Tv strategy.? Keith Wiggins of Inview Technology said, ?Inview is delighted to be working with Haier to bring to market a truly innovative and free IP solution. We believe our platform will revolutionise the consumer electronics marketplace and significantly raise customer expectations as to what they can receive on their television? -ENDS-
About Inview Technology Limited
Inview Technology, the world's leading supplier of royalty free EPG's, supply feature rich 3rd generation EPG's that combine a recommendation engine and media browser to enable viewers to navigate content from linear TV and the internet. Inview has pioneered a revolutionary lightweight platform; NEELiX that works within existing processor and memory constraints of any product with no additional cost at manufacture, enabling full IP connectivity on the most basic set top boxes and TV's.
www.inview.co.uk
About Haier IC Design Company Ltd
Haier IC is a business of new advanced technology invested in, and established by, the Haier Group. The company incorporates a batch of designers with rich designing experience and excellent performance in the domestic IC design industry. description.hltext_display: 携帯サイト運営会社を脱税で告発 東京国税局
description.content:
Tweet 架空経費を計上する手口で法人税約５千万円を脱税したとして、東京国税局が東京都渋谷区の携帯電話サイト運営会社「ｔｓｕｍｉｋｉ ｐｒｏｍｏｔｉｏｎ（ツミキプロモーション）」と佐藤裕隆社長（３５）ら２人を法人税法違反容疑で東京地検に告発していたことが２２日、分かった。
同社は修正申告する方針という。
関係者によると、ツミキ社は広告費などについて架空経費を計上する手口で、２００８年４月期までの２年間に約１億８千万円の所得を隠し、法人税約５千万円を脱税した疑いが持たれている。 （共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: Flashes find rhythm, put Penguins on ice
description.author: Stephanie Storm
description.content:
KENT: Minus two starters and playing for the first time in nine days, Kent State spent the first half of Tuesday's game against Youngstown State trying to knock all the rust off and find a rhythm.
It took a half, but once the Golden Flashes got going, the visiting Penguins had a hard time keeping up as KSU cruised to a 71-58 victory at the M.A.C. Center.
With the win, the Flashes (9-3) extended their homecourt winning streak to 15 games.
Youngstown State dropped to 5-6 on the season, including an 0-6 record on the road.
''We came out lethargic on offense and maybe a little on defense as well,'' Kent State coach Geno Ford said. ''But once we got a couple stops and a couple easy ones, we started to play better together.''
Off for more than a week for finals and playing without juniors Carlton Guyton (suspended indefinitely) and Justin Manns (coach's decision), the undermanned Flashes struggled out of the gate. Youngstown raced to a 17-5 lead fueled by three 3-pointers.
Less than five minutes into the game, Penguins 6-foot-7 Lithuanian guard Vytas Sulskis had already reached double-figure scoring and finished the half with 16 of his game-high 22 points.
''I look up, and I don't know if we'd broke a sweat yet, and he's got 15 already,'' Ford said of Sulskis.
The Flashes eventually found some rhythm and used a 9-0 run midway through the half to begin to close the gap. But every time KSU challenged the lead, a YSU player would step up and make a 3-pointer to keep the Flashes at bay.
The Flashes managed to convert just 1-for-8 from 3-point range � a Darius Leonard 3-pointer just before the buzzer � and the Penguins had five.
With the Flashes struggling to get their offense going in the first half, there wasn't a lot for the home fans to cheer about � until new football coach Darrell Hazell took the court at halftime.
''You have waited long enough,'' Hazell told KSU fans at halftime with a microphone in hand at center court. ''You deserve it!''
Before the former Ohio State receivers coach left, he said there was one more thing. He put the microphone down, took off his sport coat, loosened his tie and unbuttoned his dress shirt to reveal a white T-shirt underneath that read: Beat Akron. He left the court to a standing ovation.
But the Flashes kept Hazell from stealing the show as their long-range shooting began to come around in the second half. Randall Holt made two of his three 3-pointers, Michael Porrini added another and Rod Sherman made all three free throws after being fouled from beyond the arc to tie the score at 48-48.
Justin Greene's short jumper with 9:20 to go gave KSU its first lead of the night. Suddenly, it was Youngstown State trying to play catch up and the Flashes' lead quickly swelled to 11 points. In addition to back-to-back 3-pointers, this time by Holt and Sherman, YSU went nine-plus minutes with just one basket and two free throws.
On defense, the Flashes held Sulskis to six second-half points.
''A lot of our bad offense led to bad defense,'' YSU coach Jerry Slocum said. ''This is one of the best Kent State teams I've seen since I've been here. When they get those guys back, they'll be very good.''
Notebook
Next on the Flashes' schedule is a trip to Morehead State on Tuesday. The squad returns home to the M.A.C. Center Dec. 31 for a 2 p.m. New Year's Eve contest against James Madison.
Stephanie Storm can be reached at sstorm@thebeaconjournal.com.

description.hltext_display: Prospect breaks away from Gilford
description.content:
R.C. Greenwood/Laconia Citizen photo Debora Bulhoes of Prospect Mountain grabs a rebound from Abagail Harris of Gilford during their Division III matchup Tuesday evening in Gilford.
GILFORD — Prospect Mountain High School coach Jeri Blair had a simple reason for his team's sudden scoring spike, and it wasn't rocket science.
"The ball went in the hoop," he said.
Until the fourth quarter, there wasn't a whole lot of that from either side.
The Prospect girls finally broke open a low-scoring struggle, ripping off 16 fourth-quarter points to secure a 36-20 Division III win at Gilford Tuesday night.
The Timberwolves, who led just 20-18 entering the fourth, complemented the breakout with solid defense. They held Gilford to two points in the fourth — and six in the second half — while swiping 10 steals in the game.
"We really didn't change a lot," Blair said. "I tried different people in different places trying to find somebody who could stick the ball" in the basket.
Senior Debora Bulhoes provided a spark, scoring in the post off a feed from Sahara Brown to put the Timberwolves up 24-18. Prospect guard Izzy Glazier later set up Bulhoes for a fast-break bucket that had them up 12 with less than a minute to play.
"We had (seven) turnovers in the fourth quarter and we had eight in the first half. So that's kind of telltale," Gilford coach Rick Forge said. "And it wasn't that they were putting any pressure, it's just we started forcing some things. We started making some bad passes. Our decision making wasn't good early in the fourth quarter."
Bulhoes scored seven of her nine points in the second half and added seven rebounds and four steals. Glazier finished with 10 points and four steals and center Sydney Robertson had 10 points, five rebounds and seven blocks to pace Prospect, which improved to 3-2 entering the holiday break.
"I thought tonight we at least moved the ball a little bit better than we have been," Blair said. "We were a little more patient. We've got to hit the outside shots. We've got the outside shooters to do it, too. Tonight we just weren't hitting them."
Prospect senior Rachel Roberge hit the game's only 3-pointer late in the second quarter. The rest of the first-half scoring came around the basket — where there were typically eight to 10 bodies. The Timberwolves took a 15-14 lead into halftime after Gilford's Molly Dietrich hit three free throws with 2.4 seconds left.
Gilford scored three of its four first-half baskets in the paint. The other, a short baseline jumper by Abby Harris, was close enough. The Timberwolves responded in the second half by sealing off the paint with their packed-in zone, daring the struggling Eagles to attack from the arch.
Those shots weren't falling for either team, but Gilford finished just 7 of 42 (16.7 percent) from the field overall.
"Once they realized we didn't have anyone who was going to make an outside shot tonight, then they could pack it in," Forge said of Prospect's zone. "It's just something we've got to work on."
Points suddenly started pouring in for Prospect in the fourth quarter. Brown picked off a pass during a full-court press and finished off the glass in the opening minute. Bulhoes worked the low post for a bucket about a minute later, and Glazier's steal and coast-to-coast layup had Prospect ahead 27-18 with 4 minutes to play.
Gilford's only make of the quarter came in the paint with 2:55 left. Harris slipped the ball to center Olivia Broderick down low for a bucket that stopped Prospect's 7-0 run.
But to Forge, the quarter in a nutshell came moments earlier, when the Golden Eagles out-hustled the Timberwolves for six offensive rebounds on one possession — and still couldn't score.
"That kind of just gave you the synopsis of what that whole fourth quarter was about," Forge said, "when we had those six consecutive shots, no longer than six feet, that we couldn't get in the basket down there. We just couldn't get going in that fourth quarter."
Prospect closed the game with nine unanswered points. Robertson finished off a three-point play inside and the Timberwolves went 5 for 5 from the foul line in the final 2:13 of regulation.
Harris led the Eagles with seven points, 10 rebounds and three steals. Broderick finished with six points, Dietrich had five, and sophomore forward Hayley Jakubens had eight rebounds off the bench for the Eagles.
The game was tied on two separate occasions and Gilford led once, when Broderick converted consecutive post buckets in the first quarter to give Gilford a 4-0 lead. The game was tied 5-5 at the end of the first and 18-18 with 1:43 left in the third, when Gilford's Sarah Veazey knocked down a 15-footer.
The teams could meet again in the 37th annual Lakes Region Holiday Tournament, which tips off on Monday morning.
TIMBERWOLVES, 36-20
PROSPECT MTN. (36) Bulhoes 4-1-9, Robertson 3-4-10, Roberge 2-0-5, Brown 1-0-2, Glazier 3-4-10, Laroche 0-0-0, Barrett 0-0-0, Burke 0-0-0, Adams 0-0-0, Lizotte 0-0-0. Totals: 13-9—36.
GILFORD (20) Veazey 1-0-2, Laliberte 0-0-0, Dietrich 1-3-5, Harris 2-3-7, Broderick 3-0-6. Jakubens 0-0-0, Brunt. Totals: 7-6—20.
PROSPECT (4-2) 5 10 5 16 — 36
GILFORD (1-3) 5 9 4 2 — 20

description.hltext_display: 開示外交文書の要旨 (12月22日 11:57)
Falcons' don't falter despite free throws
description.author: Jim Isabella
description.content:
MACEDONIA: Joe Wojcik walked up and down the bench, exclaimed ''Yeah,'' and started applauding. It was a moment of sarcasm and frustration for the Firestone coach that came after DeAire Andrew made a free throw.
The Falcons' coach can be forgiven for rolling his eyes and having an amused look on his face, because Firestone defeated Nordonia 63-51 Thursday night in a battle of unbeatens in the Knights' gym.
Wojcik was happy to see his team come out with the victory and improve to 4-0.
''It was a good game. Our first test on the road against a real good team,'' Wojcik said. ''Nordonia is quick and athletic and can shoot the ball. We knew we would be in for a hassle. I'm proud of the way we played.''
There was a ''but'' coming, because there was a glaring part of the Falcons' game that
made Wojcik ready to take about 10 aspirins or a gallon of Maalox.
''But we have to make foul shots. In the fourth quarter we were 3-of-11 in the final 50 seconds,'' Wojcik said. ''You can't do that against a good team. It will come up and bite you once in a while.''
The Falcons' foul shoots frequently clanged off the rim. They made just 12-of-28 free throws.
It was also a sore point with the Falcons players.
''We need to work on our free throws so we can finish teams off late in the game,'' said sophomore center Darius Carter, who led Firestone in scoring with 17 points.
''The main thing is we missed our free throws. If we make our free throws, we could have won more easily,'' said Firestone sophomore Kevin Gladney, who had 13 points. ''We played hard and aggressive and got the win.''
Carter also was happy with the Falcons' overall play and suggested he had revenge in his heart.
''Everybody played hard and everybody played tough,'' Carter said. ''They [the Knights] took us out of the [sectional] tournament [last year], and I like how everybody played hard. We expect a lot from each other; we just flow together.''
The Knights, particularly Nick Rodriguez, came out firing. A junior guard, Rodriguez made three of his four 3-point shots in the first quarter to give the Knights a 16-12 lead. In the second quarter, Carter started to find his range and scored six as the Falcons cut the lead to 24-22 by halftime.
''We came out a little jittery and a little nervous, and then we settled down,'' Wojcik said.
The third quarter proved to be the turning point as the Falcons started pressing and frustrating the Knights, who were stone cold. Firestone outscored Nordonia 20-9 to lead 42-33 by the end of the quarter.
Nordonia also suffered a devastating blow when junior center Jarrett Ruffin fouled out, getting two quick fouls before play stopped and coach Matt Cash could get a substitute in for him.
''It was sloppy. In the second and third quarter, we just did not have hustle. We just played a bad game tonight,'' Cash said.
The Knights (4-1) got a game-high 19 points from senior Nick Robertson.
Read the high school blog at http://www.ohiomm.com/blogs/varsity_letters/. Also on Twitter at http://twitter.com/ABJ_Varsity.

description.hltext_display: Münevver'in katili 'çok zeki' çıktı!
description.content:
Adli Tıp Kurumu 6. İhtisas Dairesi, başı kesilerek öldürüldükten sonra Etiler'de bir çöp konteynerine atılan Münevver Karabulut'un katil zanlısı Cem Garipoğlu'nun 19 günlük müşahedesi sonucunda düzenlediği raporda, IQ'sunun 119 olarak ölçüldüğünü ve yüksek zekâ seviyesine sahip bulunduğunu, kişiliğinin ise "şizoid" yani sosyal çekingen bir yapıda olduğunu bildirdi. Ceza ehliyetinin tam olduğu sonucuna varılan raporda, CemGaripoğlu'nun olay günü de ceza ehliyetini etkileyecek veya ortadan kaldıracak herhangi bir akıl hastalığı ve akıl zayıflığı olmadığı kaydedildi.
'KENDİNİ BEĞENİYOR'Cem Garipoğlu'nun psikogram değerlendirilmesi sonucu, sosyal çevreyle ilişkilerinin kuru ve yüzeysel olduğu, bedeniyle ilgili güvensizlik duyguları yaşadığı, öz beğeninin azalmasına bağlı endişe kaygısının olduğu ve depresyona eğiliminin bulunduğu, ama buna karşın narsistik yani kendini mükemmel gören savunmalar kullandığı ve kişilik bütünlüğünü koruma çabası içinde olduğu tespit edildi.ŞİZOİD NEDİR?Şizoid kişilik bozukluğu tanısı yaşam boyunca sosyal çekingenlik gösteren hastalara konur. Bunlar insan ilişkilerinde yetersiz, içe dönük, donuk, kısıtlı hareketleri ile dikkat çekerler. Şizoid kişilik bozukluğu olan kişiler başkalarından daha tuhaf, izole veya yalnız görünürler.

description.hltext_display: Seminoles no match for hungry Huskies
description.author: Doug Feinberg
description.content:
HARTFORD, CONN.: Men's teams. Women's teams. No. 89 belongs to UConn. It beats them all.
The No. 1-ranked Huskies women's basketball team topped the 88-game winning streak set by John Wooden's UCLA men's team from 1971-74, beating No. 22 Florida State 93-62 on Tuesday night. Playing with the relentlessness that has become its trademark � and would have made Wooden proud � Connecticut blew past the Seminoles (9-3) as it has so many other teams in the past 21/2 years.
Maya Moore had a double-double with a career-high 41 points and 10 rebounds and Bria Hartley added 21 points for the Huskies (11-0), who have not lost since April 6, 2008, in the NCAA Tournament semifinals. Only twice during the record run has a team come within single digits of UConn � Stanford in the NCAA championship game last season and Baylor in early November.
When the final buzzer sounded, UConn players sprinted across the floor to shake hands with the student section as fans held up signs with ''89'' and the Huskies logo on them. After a brief huddle in front of their bench, UConn players re-emerged wearing ''89 and Counting'' T-shirts and bounced around at center court before posing for photos.
''I'm not John Wooden and this isn't UCLA,'' coach Geno Auriemma said. ''This is Connecticut and that's good enough.''
It is one more chapter of history for UConn, and perhaps the grandest.
Connecticut long ago established itself as the marquee program in the women's game, the benchmark by which all others are measured. The Huskies already own seven national titles and four perfect seasons under Auriemma, and they've produced a galaxy of stars that includes Rebecca Lobo, Diana Taurasi, Jennifer Rizzotti, Sue Bird and Tina Charles.
Two days after beating No. 11 Ohio State to tie UCLA, UConn toppled the mark in front of a sellout crowd of 16,294 at the XL Center that included Wooden's grandson, Greg, attending his first women's game.
''My grandfather would have been thrilled. He would have been absolutely thrilled to see his streak broken by a women's basketball team,'' the 47-year-old Wooden said. ''He thought, especially in the last 10 years, that the best basketball was played at the collegiate level � and it wasn't by the men.''
John Wooden, the beloved Wizard of Westwood, died June 4 at age 99.

event_or_fact.property: I'm not John Wooden and this isn't UCLA; This is Connecticut and that's good enough.

description.hltext_display: Nueva Zelanda desclasifica informes militares sobre ovnis y extraterrestres
description.content:
El Ejército de Nueva Zelanda desclasificó este miércoles cientos de informes militares hasta ahora secretos sobre presuntos avistamientos de ovnis y encuentros con alienígenas, informó la radio nacional.
Más de 2.000 páginas de datos incluyen testimonios de civiles, militares y pilotos comerciales que afirmaron haber visto en el cielo objetos voladores no identificados, aunque casi todos fueron simples efectos de los movimientos de la luz.
Los informes contienen dibujos de platillos volantes, detalladas descripciones de extraterrestres que portaban máscaras similares a las de los faraones egipcios y textos supuestamente escritos por marcianos.
Un caso concreto relata un avistamiento en 1978 de luces extrañas a bordo de un avión comercial cerca de la población de Kaikoura en la Isla Sur.

description.hltext_display: ２度目の保釈請求を却下 大阪地裁、前特捜部長らに
description.content:
Tweet 大阪地検特捜部の証拠改ざん隠蔽事件で、大阪地裁（畑山靖裁判官）は２２日、犯人隠避罪で起訴された前特捜部長大坪弘道（５７）、元副部長佐賀元明（４９）両被告の２度目の保釈請求を却下した。大坪前部長と佐賀元副部長は準抗告する方針。
２人の弁護側は２０日、「証拠隠滅の恐れはない」として保釈請求。地裁は、１０月の１度目の保釈請求を却下し、準抗告も棄却している。
２人は１７日の第１回公判前整理手続きで、無罪を主張していく方針を表明している。 （共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: Red Raiders blow out Concord
description.content:
ROCHESTER — The Spaulding High School basketball team struggled to find its rhythm in the first half of Tuesday's Division I game with Concord.
The second half, however, was a completely different story.
After taking a slim four-point lead into halftime, the Red Raiders enjoyed a big second-half explosion en route to a convincing 66-41 win. Spaulding outscored the Crimson Tide 19-6 in the third quarter and 20-12 in the fourth to take control of the game. Senior forward Ian Christie led the way with 12 points (seven in the third quarter), while senior guard Justin Slattery and sophomore forward Dominic Paradis also reached double-digits with 11 and 10, respectively.
"Concord played with a lot of energy and made us uncomfortable in the first half," Spaulding coach Tim Cronin. "We had no flow — we just couldn't get anything going. In the second half we went to the zone press and that kind of slowed them down a bit. It also helped our offense play the kind of tempo we like to."
Leading 27-23, Spaulding (2-0) opened the third quarter on 9-0 run to go up by 13. Playing a 2-1-2 full-court press, the Red Raiders came away with four steals and held the Crimson Tide (0-2) to just six total points in the frame.
"We pushed the panic button in the third (quarter)," Concord coach Dale Emerson said. "(Spaulding) played great defense — stifling defense — but we forced a lot of passes and we just don't have the experience to make good decisions under pressure."
"Ian really asserted himself in the third quarter to give us some offense," Cronin said. "He can be very effective down low when he works hard."
Holding a 17-point advantage after three (46-29), the Red Raiders kept their foot on the gas pedal in the fourth to go and win by 25.
"Spaulding has a lot of talented options," Emerson said. "Tonight they shared the ball, kept hitting the open guy — we didn't know who to stop. They were very consistent. This was a big set-back for us, though. We didn't respond to the challenge."
"I think we proved in the second half that when the ball is passed ahead instead of dribbled it makes a world of difference," Cronin said. "We got some steals off the press and passing up court led to layups. There was no wasted time dribbling."
Spaulding beat the buzzer on 3-pointers in the first and second quarters, as Taylor Giullian gave the Red Raiders a 13-10 lead at the end of one, while Slattery made it 27-23 on his triple to close out the first half. Slattery was fouled on the play, but was unable to convert the four-point play with the free throw. The ball wound up in Slattery's hands after a wild back-and-forth sequence over the last 15 seconds.
"The ball was on the ground and I picked it up and looked at the clock real quick," Slattery said. "There were only a couple seconds left, so I kind of just threw it up. The ref called a foul and it went in."
Spaulding jogged into the locker room for halftime with a bounce in its step, while Concord walked in, heads down.
"I think a play like that picks the whole team's energy level up," Slattery said. "It gave us some good momentum heading into the second half."
Junior guards PJ Juneau and Conner Noe both enjoyed exceptional defensive games Tuesday, while Juneau also added nine points.
"Conner and PJ gave us great energy tonight," Cronin said. "They really helped set the tone early in the second half. We're pleased at 2-0, but we still have a long way to go. We need to keep on improving, and make progress everyday."
Spaulding is back in action at the Oyster River Holiday Classic Monday, 5:30 p.m., against Sanford, Maine.
Spaulding, 66-41
Concord (41) — K. Marquis 3-0-7, Mugunga 2-1-5, Osgood 1-0-2, Woods 1-0-2, Iozza 1-0-2, Yeng-jesus 1-0-2, Sullivan 1-0-2, Lynch 2-1-5, Kaneza 0-1-1, I. Marquis 4-0-9, Beauchemin 1-0-2, Jewell 0-0-0, Owen 1-0-2. Totals: 18-3-41.
Spaulding (66) — Giullian 2-3-8, Roberts 1-0-2, Cronin 3-0-6, Slattery 3-4-11, Paradis 4-2-10, Christie 4-4-12, Turbitt 0-0-0, Upham 0-0-0, Juneau 4-1-9, MacGregor 2-0-4, Todd 0-0-0, Noe 1-0-2, Russell 1-0-2. Totals: 25-14-66.
Concord (0-2) 10 13 6 12 — 41
Spaulding (2-0) 13 14 19 20 — 66
3-pointers: C-2 (K. Marquis, I. Marquis), S-2 (Giullian, Slattery).

description.hltext_display: Judge denies contempt charge against Reckwerdt
description.content:
MARATHON -- Circuit Court Judge Ruth Becker has denied a prosecutor's office motion to have Islamorada Mayor Michael Reckwerdt held in contempt of court.
But the dispute over how much Reckwerdt must divulge to the Monroe County State Attorney's Office as they investigate the mayor's estranged wife, Annie, is far from resolved.
"They want to ask questions that are not relevant," Reckwerdt's attorney Jay Hershoff said outside the Marathon courthouse shortly after the hearing last Thursday morning, Dec. 16.
"This is about vindicating a principle," countered Assistant State Attorney Mark Wilson. "You don't get to not answer questions. You don't get to pick and choose what you answer."
Annie Reckwerdt, 41, was arrested on Sept. 25 after she allegedly bloodied her husband with a punch to the face and then attempted to run him down with a golf cart.
The state has yet to file charges. However, Annie has already pled not guilty via written notice to the court. She has also initiated divorce proceedings against the mayor.
But though Reckwerdt has described the events of that evening under oath in a deposition related to the divorce case, he declined to take prosecutors' questions when he sat down with them on Oct. 18 in response to a subpoena.
The office of State Attorney Dennis Ward argues that refusal amounts to contempt of court -- an offense punishable by a fine to jail time.
At the hearing last week, however, Hershoff said that prosecutors failed to do their job during that interview.
"The state never asked him individual questions," Hershoff said in reference to Reckwerdt. "It was just a blanket question: 'Are you going to answer questions?'"
Becker sided with Hershoff, ruling that Reckwerdt complied with the subpoena by showing up for the Oct. 18 interview.
But though she ruled against this contempt motion, the decision didn't close the door on the question of how much Reckwerdt must share with the State Attorney's Office.
Hershoff says his client will answer questions that are directly related to the events of Sept. 25, when Annie allegedly attacked the mayor after encountering him alone in a dark spot on the Robbie's Marina property with another woman. Reckwerdt, 43, has already stated in civil court papers that his wounds required 12 stitches.
But Wilson says he also wants to ask the mayor questions about additional allegations of domestic violence, as well as about extramarital affairs. Such details would be relevant to Annie's state of mind on the night in question, he argues.
Hershoff says his client won't respond to such queries. And he further says that the prosecutor's office is targeting Reckwerdt.
Never in recent memory have Monroe County prosecutors sought a contempt finding against a victim who declined to cooperate against their spouse in a domestic battery case. Meanwhile, the animus between Ward and Reckwerdt is well known.
If Reckwerdt refuses to answer some of Wilson's questions when they next meet, the state the could ask Becker once again to determine if his actions amount to contempt.
During last week's hearing, Becker said the state must present a more specific complaint before she would have cause to give the matter a more thorough review.
"We'll submit something that is more detailed," Wilson responded.

Bobcats run STA ragged
description.content:
Mike Whaley/Democrat photo Oyster River's Danielle Walczak, right, puts up a shot over St. Thomas' Meaghan Flynn (25) and Blaire Fenniman during Division II action Tuesday in Durham.
DURHAM — With reigning Division II/Class I Player of the Year Danielle Walczak setting up shop in and around the paint area, it's obvious that Oyster River High School's girls basketball team has an edge in the post-up game.
Sure enough, Walczak scored 22 points and was the dominant player during Tuesday's 52-30 win against local rival St. Thomas Aquinas.
"They have like four girls over 5-10 and we don't have anybody 5-10, so we knew that was going to be a struggle," St. Thomas head coach Sabrina Payeur said. "I thought Meaghan Flynn did a great job. She did the best she could on her. I thought our help defense was really awesome."
But when the game was still a contest midway through the second quarter, it was Bobcats' ability to run the court that blew the game open. Oyster River used a 12-0 tear in the closing three minutes of the first half to turn a slender 4-point lead into a 31-15 halftime advantage. The offensively challenged Saints, who shot 25 percent from the floor (12 of 48), trailed by at least 14 the rest of the way.
"The key for us was the 12-0 run at the end of the first half," OR head coach Dave Nichols said.
"For whatever reason we got shaken up by that press," Payeur said. "We just couldn't recover but again that's just part of having a young team and having to work through things like that."
"What happened was, the front three was creating pressure that was causing kind of poor passes over their head and the girls in the back, especially Isabel Gorham, were coming up with the steals."
Reserve guard Hallie Miller started the run when she scored at the back of a quick feed up court off a long rebound. Then Gorham converted a Saints turnover into a 3-point play by quickly stepping past STA defender Gretchen Anderson with 1:54 to play. Coming out of a timeout, and in quick succession, OR's Riley Maynard hit a 3-pointer, Graham beat everyone up court for another layup and Walczak finished it with one of her nine baskets.
Oyster River improved to 3-0. St. Thomas is now 1-3.
To be sure, the Bobcats' number one option is to run cutters through the lanes and then to look for Walczak, who recently committed as a scholarship athlete at the University of Maine. After a sluggish start, the 6-foot-1 senior aggressively secured the catch then scored on solid drop-steps to set up both left- and right-handed shots. In the fourth quarter, she was beating the STA defense up the court for transition layups.
"We weren't getting her the ball well in the first few minutes. Poor angles on our passes and of course they're looking for it," Nichols said. "Once we started executing better that helped her and that's when she picked it up but it wasn't that she was slacking off earlier than that, either."
Oyster River did struggle at times with its offensive execution, committing 23 turnovers. When set, however, they converted at a high percentage, making nearly 50 percent of its shots (22 of 45). Part of the problem, Nichols said, is that four Bobcats are out with a combination of illness and injury. The most serious might be sophomore guard Courtney Tewksbury who has been diagnosed with Lyme disease and could miss the entire season, Nichols said. Tewksbury probably would have been the first guard off the bench.
"They're progressing," Nichols said. "We're seeing longer stretches of good execution and shorter periods of ugly basketball."
St. Thomas showed throughout the game that it could get open shots, both on the perimeter and slashing to the basket. Gretchen Anderson was effective early; scoring six of her team-high dozen while the game was still close, with Katherine Lukens also making a pair early in the second quarter. The problem became knocking any shots down.
"I thought we had a bunch of great looks," Payeur said, "both with the drives and outside. For whatever reason we just can't get them to drop. I think it's just part of having a young team. We're a very, very new team and we have yet to have a full roster at practice. Injuries, sickness, what have you, we haven't had all 12 ready to suit up one day, yet."
Oyster River, 52-30
ST. THOMAS (30) — Lukens 2-0-4, Coney 0-0-0, Cranney 0-0-0, Fenniman 1-0-3, Wyrsch 0-0-0, Loch 0-0-0, L. Davis 2-0-4, Michaud 0-0-0, Flynn 3-1-7, Anderson 4-4-12, Poulin 0-0-0. Totals: 12-5-30.
OYSTER RIVER (52) — Thibeault 0-0-0, Miller 2-0-4, MacDonald 3-2-8, Brown 1-0-2, Davidson 0-0-0, Gorham 4-1-9, D. Walczak 9-4-22, Goodwin 1-0-2, Kolter 1-0-2, Maynard 1-0-3. Totals: 22-7-52.
St. Thomas (1-3) 7 8 9 6 — 30
Oyster River (3-0) 10 21 8 13 — 52
3-pointers: STA-1 (Fenniman); OR-1 (Maynard).
